p: Jordan et al. [ 20] explained that the highest antimicrobial and antioxidant activities of rosemary essential oils and phenolic extracts collected at the fruit maturation phase, compared to full bloom, were due to variations in the contents of several terpenes and phenols. In general, variations occurring in rosemary terpene and phenol phenotypes are the product of the interaction of the genes with the environment and are also due to plant ontogeny and phenology [ 21, 22].
